body: Pro-opposition activists in the Armenian Diaspora are starting to use rap music to communicate their message ahead of next week's demonstration in Yerevan while youth movements in Azerbaijan have long been doing so. Uploaded to YouTube in October, one example is Shirbənd with Bizimlə ol (Join Us) as opposition groups in the oil-rich republic also warn of an "Egyptian scenario" unless new parliamentary elections are called.
original_body: Pro-opposition activists in the Armenian Diaspora are starting to use rap music to communicate their message ahead of next week's demonstration in Yerevan while youth movements in Azerbaijan have long been doing so. Uploaded to YouTube in October, one example is Shirbənd with Bizimlə ol (Join Us) as opposition groups in the oil-rich republic also warn of an "Egyptian scenario" unless new parliamentary elections are called.
title: Azerbaijan: Join Us

sentence: Pro-opposition activists in the Armenian Diaspora are starting to use rap music to communicate their message ahead of next week's demonstration in Yerevan while youth movements in Azerbaijan have long been doing so.

Uploaded to YouTube in October, one example is Shirbənd with Bizimlə ol (Join Us) as opposition groups in the oil-rich republic also warn of an "Egyptian scenario" unless new parliamentary elections are called.
